Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rincon”
Reviews.Author: SaschaHerzig
Reviews.Content: This was my very first time staying at the Horned Dorset and I would come back in a single heart beat. I actually live in Puerto Rico and had heard and read much about this place but never took the opportunity to stay until now and i do not regret it at all. Upon arriving we were immediately greeted by staff who took our bags and brought them to the reception area. There we were greeted by Mr. Wilhelm Sack. Extremely friendly and upon finding out he was born in Austria followed to have a nice conversation in German with him. The check in process was quick and flawless. We were told that our room might not be ready yet but would show us how to get there and we could have a drink while its getting ready. We arrived to the room and to our surprise it WAS ready. We walked in the door and it was breath taking. Beautiful old style rooms that just immediately gave the feeling of being at home. The dipping pool was incredible. The view from the terraze spectacular. The sound of the ocean waves crashing on the beach was exactly what we were looking for. This was only the first floor. Going to the second floor the huge beautifully appointed bathroom. Enormous bed. And even more breath taking views from the balcony. We feel in love right then and there and knew the 2 nights would not e enough. The food - lunch and dinnet were delicious. Tasteful. And filling. The presentation of the food was amazing. The first day we ordered lunch for room service and the waiter set the table with a white table cloth and made us feel like we were actually eating at a restaurant instead of our room. The staff is friendly. Attentive and very helpful. While on the beach i wandered up to the veranda and asked one of the waiters where the bar was. He asked me why and if i wanted a drink. I said yes that i would like a mojito and piÃ±a colada. He said please go back to the beach as they are obligated to bring the drinks to us. WOW. The place itself is secluded. Quiet. Tranquil. And hidden away. As other reviews state. Dont expect to be partying here. This place is to go. Escape in the tranquility. Gather yourself and recharge. You actually lose yourself being here and forget even what day or time it is. It is pure relaxation. When we woke up Sunday morning the thought of having to check out and drive back to San Juan entered our minds and were deeply saddened that it ended so quick. Had Monday not been another working day we would have stayed another night no questions asked. Thank you to Mr. Sack and his entire staff for running such an amazing hotel with attention to detail. I can not say a single bad thing. I hope to be back soon and many more times to escape the hectic San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Relaix et Chateau hotel on the water lives up to its billing”
Reviews.Author: Happytrails1110
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beachfront hotel with a very accommodating staff and two story attached villas decorated exquiaitely in Moroccan style.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but please pick up the trash on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: SharonHerrera
Reviews.Content: Exceptional place, a good quiet retreat for a weekend away. We had a really lovely time. Thank you for keeping such a quiet place. Please do have your staff pick up the garbage on the beach that drifts in, there was a lot of it. If they could do that it would be great and environmentally sensitive. But the stay was excellent....

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary retreat. The finest of everything.”
Reviews.Author: ldm010
Reviews.Content: The Horned Dorset is that rare place generally shared very quietly - among friends - and only to SOME of your friends. It is a place you would never want spoiled. It is true - it feels like your home. And as Anne Morrow once wrote "I shall invite into my shell, only those with whom I can be completely honest". It is quiet. It is resplendant. The management is perfect and personal - it is apparant that each guest is the personal responsibility of your hosts. The chef is stunning and the food is accordinly amazing. The enitre staff takes cares for you as if you are guests in their home - -for example - two hours after our arrival - as we were enjoying wine with our friends on couches in the bar/library - - the waiter came with a smile and a tray - and very gently announced "excuse me, but it is important that we should move you to the terrace just over there - the sun is setting now - you should be there to enjoy it." And indeed we did.... Dinner was exquisite. We had opted for the meal plan - thus It began with a pureed mushroom soup, followed by salmon gravlax, then beef filet (I substituted roasted breast of duck) and then baked chocolate pie ( which my husband adored - I substituted chocolate cake with a molten coconut center and coconut ice cream on the side - exceeded only by a friend's rasberry souffle with cream anglaise and cinnamon ice cream on the side) - As our post-dessert coffee was being served, our waiter (without being asked) took a moment to explain to us where breakfast would be served in the morning - and a few other details - just as you would explain to guests in your home. The suites - a small apartment in fact - are furnished with incredibly beautiful traditional furniture - featured a living room, full bath, kitchen, espresso maker and terrace with lounge chairs, table, market umbrella and plunge pool downstairs - and a wonderful bedroom and sitting room upstairs - with a canapied bed, enormous bathroom, huge footed whirlpool tub, rainshower, 2 sinks etc - and balcony terrace overlooking the ocean....upstairs. Two larger pools with terraces and lounge chairs etc - - - one an infinity overlooking the ocean - were delightful. The building for dinner, lunch and breakfast - - with bar/library - featured open terraces -and intimate, exquisitely decorated air conditioned rooms - just incredible. This is a quiet place. Do not come here looking for a party - unless you rent the entire hotel for a group - - - and do not make a party - - those around you are relishing the peace and gentility. Should you want to explore beyond the hotel - there is much to do and enjoy in Rincon. For example, we chartered a catamaran from the nearby marina and enjoyed a morning on the water - snorkeling and looking for whales. This is a wonderful wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Our 20th year!”
Reviews.Author: Martha C
Reviews.Content: The Horned Dorset is like home, only better. Not only do we adore the quiet pampering (who gets this at home?), but also we love coming back to what is so different from any other place we have ever visited. Sure it's comforting to know that decisions don't have to be made--I always put my bathing suit in the left top dresser drawer and my husband takes the closet shelf for his, but even more significant is our delight in watching the waiters grow up (some don't seem to want to), in petting the "family" dogs, perusing the library of old books, and talking to fellow vacationers, who, like us, have found the perfect, restorative place. If you're looking for yoga at nine, followed by volleyball at noon, cooking classes at two and karioke at ten, stay far away. On the other hand, If you want to read a book for five hours stretches under a carefully placed umbrella overlooking a quiet cove and follow it up with a great meal served in what is perhaps the most beautiful dining room ever created, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. Incredible place.”
Reviews.Author: cliffview12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great vacation in Puerto Rico, and this place takes the cake!!! I had plans to do some touring and couldn't pull myself away from the hotel. The setting is beautiful. Our room had a gorgeous ocean view and we hit balmy weather. We slept with the windows open and listened to the surf. We had breakfast 2 mornings on the grassy area by the "blue room" where it was served--ocean front! We ate dinner one night in the fancy restaurant (Aaron) upstairs and it was very nice--only problem was my fish wasn't warm enough so I sent it back with a bite out of it and they brought my a whole new fish. We ate the second night in the "Blue Room" and had a wonderful waiter-Peter-who made every attempt to make our evening wonderful. The beach area had some chaise lounges with umbrellas. It was a small beach, but secluded and nice. The room was lovely with great appointments. There is a grocery market called Edwards nearby and we bought salami, cheese, bread, and wine and made our own lunch both days. This is a very romantic place. We plan on going back again. It is a bit expensive, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot,nice staff,very slow service,average food”
Reviews.Author: LPB_10
Reviews.Content: I would love to love this place, but just couldn't. Went with our family over the Christmas break. Arrived Christmas night late and had requested a light dinner and wine in our room. We found a small cheese plate in our fridge which had frozen over, no wine (they mixed up the order some how and were very apologetic). They brought something a half hour later (at midnight) which was ok, but they ended up charging us for the whole thing-most places I think would have comped something like that Fans for A/C in the rooms were so loud that we had to open windows at night-and it was quite warm, so our sleep quality was low. Breakfast the first morning took 1.5 hours. They do not provide activities, which is fine and very clear in their literature. There are two kayaks on the beach. Beach is small, but lovely. There was no snorkeling equipment, so one of the staff went to buy for us-they were very nice and really wanted to be helpful at every turn. One day we ordered lunch to be brought to the beach. After a half hour, I inquired about the status of the food and was told (at 12:30 pm) that the cooks were on break and it would be another 15-20 minutes. Food in nice restaurant was great, but wine list had no reasonable choices (starting at $75 and going up from there). The public space was very relaxing and comfortable-great sunsets. Two nice pools. Overall, we had a great time in Rincon, but the hotel was a weakness in the trip. I do understand, though, that it is the nicest choice in the area. V. expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Romantic vacations ever”
Reviews.Author: Carla J
Reviews.Content: We loved the little colonial house with the swimming pool in the patio. We will remember this experience forever!

Reviews.Title: “Has certainly dropped a notch”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixFF
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel several times with our last visit being 5 years ago when we got engaged over dinner at Aarons. We just visited for our 5th anniversary and stayed 5 days. There have been extensive renovations to the property with new entrance and "new" villas on the left hand side of the property. There are now 22 villas which are 2 floors with 2 baths and plunge pool. The new villas are very nice and we stayed in one of these units with an ocean view. They have tile/marble and are furnished with antiques.to Another new development is the ongoing sale of the remaining 17 units-right hand side of property as the "Residences at Horned Dorset". Approximately one third of these have been sold with at least one resale on the market. The level of service and attention to detail that we experienced previously is no longer present. It's a subtle change but definitely noticeable. There was an "owner" on site and it seemed most of the attention of the staff was directed at them. I guess that is to be expected if you purchase a unit there. Our biggest disappointment was with Aarons the main restaurant. On our prior visit we had some of the best meals of our lifetime in this restaurant and were very excited with our return. The food was mediocre at best. Undercooked without much taste we actually sent a dish back to the kitchen. After 2 nights with similar quality food we canceled our meal plan and ate out on the island. We subsequently found out from the staff the Chef Aaron has the left the property. He is now working on Martha's Vineyard. I am not sure this is public knowledge as the staff member seemed reluctant to answer when I asked about Chef Aaron. Overall the Horned Dorset is a special place for us since we got engaged here. The hotel and surroundings are beautiful. Unfortunately the service has declined and it is unclear whether it's related to the development of the "residences". The restaurant was the biggest disappointment and it is unclear who is running the kitchen. Overall we give it 3 stars down from 5 on our prior stays

Reviews.Title: “A little stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: We only ate dinner here and the meal was quite expensive. The food was good, but I dont think that it justified the expense. I think you were basically paying for the ambiance and service. Probably wouldn't come back just for a meal. The grounds were beautiful though and if you can afford a room, I think it would be worth it for the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a romantic, discreet, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep K
Reviews.Content: Tucked by the beach in a corner of Rincon is this Relais and Chateaux group luxury hotel. It was quite a splurge (almost $ 700 for a night) but it was a special occasion and so we thought, why not, for once? It is a lovely property that provides discreet, luxurious service: you may feel that you are the only ones around on the property, yet the staff is always available and attentive when needed. The room we had was amazing: it was on two levels, with a plunge pool of our own and beautiful views from the bedroom level. Children are not allowed, and the aim is to have a piece of your own paradise, quiet and secluded. There are no televisions either. There have a couple of beautiful pools, the property is lush green, and in the evenings you can enjoy spectacular sunsets. It is an extremely romantic setting and a perfect place for a special occasion with your significant other. You will go back completely rejuvenated. They also have a great restaurant on site. The cocktails are great too. I would strongly recommend that you have your own car as this property is away form main Rincon. Rincon is a lovely town and there are also some lovely small towns and beaches nearby. You may want to get out once in a while for a short drive or change of scenery, but most of the time you will be quite happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: jameslfoley
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to the Horned Dorset for her birthday and it was the perfect stay...upgrade to a beautiful seaside villa...quiet and private on both beach and pools..wonderful meals and surprise birthday dessert..can't wait to get back

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet, elegant”
Reviews.Author: bucketlistshr
Reviews.Content: HDP is well off the beaten tourist path in Rincon. About 2 hours from San Juan. Recommend driving to it in the daytime (avoid late night arrival) as desk closes at 10pm and roads are tortuous. Beautiful grounds, designed for ultra-relaxation, NO TV, No radios/alarms, and no cell phones in restaurant. small beach but nicer ones close by where the locals go. Restaurant pricey but good food and comparable to similar restaurant in the contiguous states. Service excellent, but HDP is for the guest that wants to experience serenity without a lot of overzealous staff and a plethora of activities. Villas can accommodate larger groups with upstairs and downstairs bathrooms. Private plunge pools are nice and very romantic. Common area is peaceful with elegant bar and great ocean view. Villas are spacious and grand. This is truly the place to find romance and to regenerate. Property Manager very friendly and staff is very attentive to ensuring an excellent stay. Was able to find and take a picture of the elusive coqui at this majestic hotel. infinity pool overlooking the ocean was breathtaking

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, private pool in every villa”
Reviews.Author: Lovevacation77
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it was very romantic, we had a private pool when we alked out of the villa. It has a very nice private beach. The sunset is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: sootytern
Reviews.Content: One cannot overstate the quality of this hotel. Is it expensive? Yes. Is it ridiculously expensive? Yes. Is it worth it once or twice in a lifetime for a couple of nights? Yes. The setting is magical, the food is insane, the service is amazing without seeming effusive or over-the-top, the bar is something out of a Hemingway novel, the villas are furnished with antiques, four poster beds, personal plunge pools. My wife and I took our 2 year old son here. The beach is perfect for little kids though to be honest...most people come here for peace and quiet so not too many kids. but everyone was super friendly and accommodating to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Quite lovely, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl42
Reviews.Content: Particularly given the price! My husband and I spent 7 nights at the Horned Dorset at the beginning of May for our belated honeymoon. I was less than impressed with the cold reception we received -- we arrived on a particularly rainy afternoon, and expected a nice warm greeting after our long, wet drive from San Juan. Instead, when we entered the check-in building, we had to shout to get someone's attention. The young lady came to check us in with not a single word of greeting or even a smile. Which is what it is, BUT the gentleman she called to help us with the bags was unwilling to carry our suitcases to our room until we insisted -- keep in mind the hotel is comprised of several buildings with several sets of stairs, and ours was the furthest from the check-in. Really surprising lack of customer service for such a hotel. In any event, once we were checked in, things looked brighter. The rooms are lovely, but enormous. Far more space than one couple needs (but we're from New York City, so....). The plunge pool is great, and the bath tub is beautiful and huge. I didn't love the location of our room -- it was literally right next to the stairwell, and the first room near the breakfast area. Not quite as intimate as I would have liked, but provided for easy access to the beach and the restaurants, which was nice. Speaking of the beach....perfectly nice, beautiful and tranquil, but never (and I mean never) cleaned during our entire stay! There were cigarette butts and broken pieces of plastic which I eventually gathered and stuck under my chair because they were such eyesores (needless to say, the pile of debris remained in that location). Just didn't understand why no one bothered to do some minor daily cleaning -- there were definitely plenty of staff available to do so. The food was okay -- we were there for 7 days, and ate at every restaurant multiple times. The food is definitely way overpriced, but you just have to consider it a sunk cost and not think twice about it. It was perfectly fine, but rather generic, and could certainly have benefitted from more seasonal, local and organic ingredients -- there was a dearth of fish on the menus, which I found surprising. I was also unimpressed with Restaurant Aaron -- again perfectly fine, just nothing to write home about. And the menus are small and did not change the entire time we were there -- we eventually ended up trying some restaurants in town to break the monotony. My husband took some surfing lessons arranged by the hotel with Ramses(?), and he was really pleased. All in all, a perfectly nice vacation, but NOT bucket list (for that, you should go to the Victoria Hotel in Hoi An, Vietnam).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Bradget
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Horned Dorset Primavera last week and had a wonderful time! I really can't say enough about this resort - it is truly paradise! We booked our stay through Jetsetter and had been anticipating the trip since January. We arrived late on Saturday night. We chose to fly in to Mayaguez on Cape Air rather than driving from San Juan, which was a good idea. However, note that due to the size of the aircraft, delays for weather may occur. We took a car from the airport, which was arranged by the hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel, the check-in process was easy and quick, and we were escorted to our Residence. We had originally anticipated that we would be in a Suite, but were delighted to be assigned Room 16, a large, beautiful residence with a big plunge pool and deck and unobstructed views of the ocean. We were impressed with the ornate yet comfortable furnishings in the residence. The rooms at the hotel are all about privacy - it was nearly impossible for anyone to see us while we were in our room or on the deck, and we noticed the same type of privacy in each of the other rooms on the property. Although it was apparent that there were many other guests at the hotel, we at times felt like we had the place to ourselves, which was lovely. If you're on Facebook, be sure to "like" the resort's page - it is consistently updated with upcoming events and breathtaking pictures. The service was impeccable throughout our stay - all of the staff members were friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast most mornings at the hotel, which is served overlooking the water (but which you can have delivered to your room). On our second to last night of our stay, we ate the best meal of our lives at Restaurant Aaron - we chose to get the 10-course tasting menu and were not disappointed. The service in the restaurant was wonderful and the wine pairings chosen for us were delightful. We never ate lunch at the hotel, but the menu for the Blue Room looked delicious. Since we rented a car for most of the week, we were able to explore Rincon and try some of the local restaurants. The people in Rincon were all very friendly and we ate at some wonderful restaurants, including the Rum Shack, Banana Dang, the Calypso Cafe, Tamboo, the Pool Bar, and Pizza Land. We would recommend any of these restaurants - all of the food on the island was fantastic! Although it was hard to motivate ourselves to leave our beautiful room and plunge pool, we took two day trips. We drove down the coast, ate lunch in Joyuda at El Bohio, and hiked to the Cabo Rojo lighthouse. We also went snorkeling near Descheco with the Taino Divers. We would highly recommend either of these excursions. We loved our time at the Horned Dorset Primavera and will hopefully make a return trip soon! We would highly recommend this resort to anyone. Thank you for a wonderful stay and beautiful memories.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Telluride037
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Horned Dorset and were thrilled with all aspects of our experience. From the moment that we arrived until our departure, Wilhelm and Dorset the staff provided five-star service. We opted for the daily food package that includes full breakfast and dinner, and the food was delicious. The beaches in front of the hotel were beautiful and quiet, with easy access to snorkeling and sea kayaking. We also loved the beach front suite that was exquisitely decorated and lots of privacy. The staff over-delivered on all expectations and we definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Time!!”
Reviews.Author: jebgg
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our recent trip to the Horned Dorset. Wilhelm Sack and his team did a superb job at making our visit a most delightful one. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the bed's mattress felt like a cloud; a great way to end the day (not to mention the fact that the waves were breaking on the shore just a few yards away). The hotel has a relatively new chef and he did a great job. We look forward to our next visit to the Horned Dorset.

Reviews.Title: “The way it should be”
Reviews.Author: pushhandle
Reviews.Content: My favorite time and place on planet earth is Breakfast on the water at Horned Dorset. True story. Plus 3 great pools!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Saved by the Food”
Reviews.Author: OrrvilleRedRider
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 year old son and I spent five nights at the Horned Dorset Primavera over Christmas, 2010. Although there are many superlatives that I can associate with that stay, ultimately it failed, because the hotel could not deliver one of the very basics: hot water. More later. But first, let me tell the story Our stay was in Escondida 29, a lodging styled as a â€œHorned Dorset Residenceâ€�, and which I perceive is one of the units that was part of the original property that has been sold as a â€œresidenceâ€�. During the check in process, the bellman who took us to the residence allowed that he had never been in the unit before. I believe that this residence is only rented by the hotel during peak periods â€“ so, most guests will be spared our fate. The Escondida building houses 4 units, and is the furthest unit from the main lodge building. That makes it very quiet (not that any part of the property is terribly active). We had a large living room, a full kitchen, a large full downstairs bath (shower only) and bedroom, a plunge pool and an ocean front patio. Upstairs was the master bedroom, ample closet space, and a very large bathroom with both walk-in shower and soaking tub. The master bedroom had a small balcony overlooking the plunge pool. The unit was nicely furnished â€“ albeit in a somewhat more â€œdesignerâ€� fashion than is my liking (most of the chairs were gorgeous to look at, but uncomfortable to sit in for any length of time). The air conditioning, while fairly loud when running, was extremely effective and the interior of the unit was always comfortable (and Iâ€™m very picky about cool interiors for sleeping). The bedding and linens were of first quality. The master bed was comfortable, if a tad soft for my preference. The pillows were very good. We had wireless internet in the room, which my son used to stay connected with his friends back home. As a residence, our room also had a TV. Everything in the unit was in good repair (save an ice maker in the kitchen which did not work â€“ it just leaked water when turned on). The unit was very clean. With the sole exception of the bed-side lamps, lighting was good to very good. The bed-side lamps were very beautiful, but not very effective. The grounds of the hotel were well maintained â€“ not immaculate (as I experienced at the Hacienda de San Antonio in Mexico â€“ but then Puerto Rico labor rates are higher than Mexican labor rates), but certainly more than acceptable. It might be too strong to call the grounds beautiful, but the property certainly evidenced care and attention. The main lodge building houses the restaurants and the bar. It was comfortable and well appointed, with many options for seating. The restaurants are air conditioned â€“ although the informal restaurant, The Blue Room, served meals outdoors on each of the nights we were there (and outdoors was certainly comfortable). The lodge had a gorgeous balcony on the lower floor which overlooked the sea. Housekeeping service was good, with only one hiccup â€“ we didnâ€™t get slippers until the second night (didnâ€™t know enough to ask the first night). We did not use either of the two pools, one of which is quite large and has plenty of poolside seating, preferring the small beach. Because the hotel faces south, the waves on the beach are fairly small. Nonetheless, my son and wife enjoyed the water and the beach very much. That said, no one would describe the strong point of the Horned Dorset Primavera as its beach. The hotel has a number of sea kayaks available for guests, and the wife and son made frequent use of them. The strongest points of the hotel, from my standpoint, were (i) the restaurant staff, (ii) the manager, and (iii) foremost, the food. All of the restaurant and bar staff, without exception, were gracious, welcoming and provided high service. The manager, Wilhelm Sack, is a hotel managerâ€™s manager â€“ attentive, interested in the well-being of his guests, and present. I was most impressed with Mr. Sack, and very much hope he can work to solve the problem we experienced (which I discussed with him during our stay, and as to which he made a gracious gesture). The very best part of the stay, however, was the food. It is very rare that I am interested in eating from the same kitchen five nights in a row. At the Horned Dorset, I did. We had three dinners at Restaurant Aaron, and two dinners in the outside location of the Blue Room. Each of the meals was excellent. The food was not cheap, but worth every penny. Breakfasts were very good, with a number of options that kept us interested across our five mornings. The food was so good, that it almost overcame the great failing of our stay â€“ the lack of hot water. This problem arose very quickly the first night, when my son attempted a shower. Running the water for 20 minutes resulted in nothing more than slightly less cool water. A phone call to the desk brought the suggestion that we also run the tub water full time to â€œdraw hot water to the unitâ€�. Nope, still cold. So, the wife, the son and I had quick, cold showers. The next day, I started the tub about an hour before we were to shower. The water actually got up to tepid. That said, tepid water feels cold until after youâ€™ve been standing in it for 3 or 4 minutes. We were never able to enjoy the beautiful soaking tub, because of the thought of a tepid bath gave us shivers. At no point in our five day stay did we ever have warm water, much less hot water. The wife, in desperation, even walked in her bathrobe up to the gym shower to see if she could find hot water there. No such luck. From conversations, I perceive that the hot water problem is more pronounced in the older units, and may have more or less been solved in the newer units which are normally the ones used for hotel guests. And, since our unit is apparently almost never rented out to hotel guests, most visitors may not have to put up with the problem we did. But, given a room rate approaching $1500/night for the holiday season, I canâ€™t forgive a hotel that fails in one of the very essentials. Had I known that we would not have hot water, I would not have booked my stay. Be careful about which unit you book â€“ I would focus on the newer hotel units, and avoid the residences unless you were assured that this problem had been fixed. So, itâ€™s with sadness I can tell you that our stay was a failure, and a very expensive one at that.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest Hotels Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: briancross71
Reviews.Content: This by far is one of the finest hotels I have every stayed in, it was opulent :) The marble floors and Terra Cotta was amazing, I loved the plunge pool, I want to put one in my backyard now, The Semi-private beach was amazing and so was the infinity pool :) The steak from the restaurant was amazing My new bride and I had a wonderful time :) If you get the opportunity to stay here, jump on it......

Reviews.Title: “pricey but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: karylj2000
Reviews.Content: If we could have afforded to stay here for our month long visit to Rincon, we would have. It is worth a visit just to see this beautiful property, and check it off your list of "1000 Places To See Before You Die".

Reviews.Title: “Long Overdue Review for my Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Boy
Reviews.Content: I can't even believe I have never reviewed my home away from home in Puerto Rico! If you are looking for the perfect mix of luxury and privacy, the Horned Dorset is your hotel. This is not a resort on a Caribean Island... Yes, you can have drinks by the pool, but you will not find yourself in a tacky all inclusive resort. You will be surrounded in a Mediterranean vibe, beautiful grounds and landscaping, amazing vistas of the Carribean, and the most romantic sunsets you could ask for. This place is amazing. Wilhelm the General Manager is such a kind, wonderful man. From arrival to the front office, you feel taken care of. Now, after all of these years and at least 1/2 a dozen trips, it's like visiting an old friend, being at home. Food - Rediculous... Aaron Wratten is a classically trained Chef who brings a french fusion flare to the Carribean. Dining at Restaurant Aaron is a 5* experience from serivce to food. They really do it right in so many ways. I love that the bill is simply taken care of and added to your room. The menu is always different, so it's hard to name a favorite. But if you opt for the tasting menu, you are in for a treat. If this restaurant were in Manhattan, it would give his old stomping grounds at Daniel a run for it's money. Drinks - They really make one of the cleanest, most crisp Mojitos on the island. Not too sweet, the right amount of mint. Perfection. Rooms - AMAZING! How many resorts in P.R. give EVERY GUEST ROOM it's own private plunge pool? Marble bathrooms, amazing imported fixtures from Morocco, the most comfortable 4 poster beds. I have never stayed in such spacious accommodations that were so well appointed, and for a very good value. For those with a little more to splurge, I can't say enough about the Residences. If you stay here, you opt into a meal plan and every meal is included. There is also a TV and Internet access for those of you who simply can't unplug. I really prefer staying in these rooms because they are even more spacious, right on the beach, and have larger private pools. The sounds of the waves crashing on the beach lull you into the deepest sleep. I love it!! The last trip, my boyfriend and I took the ocean kayaks for a spin and finally saw the property from the sea. It is picture perfect gorgeous. A long walk on the beach is therapy for a New Yorker. I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Horned Dorset.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my already high expectations”
Reviews.Author: candylion
Reviews.Content: From the second I stepped into the reception office to check in, I was impressed. The service was so good and so friendly. the property was beautiful as were the rooms. Both my husband and I remarked that we'd be happy to live there permanently! We stayed in a primavera suite that had its own private patio with plunge pool. Some highlights were a large soaking tub, comfortable king bed, balconies with sea view, and nice kitchenette with delicious espresso. We also enjoyed the nightly cocktail hour. We would definitely return and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: endwar
Reviews.Content: Hereâ€™s a place thatâ€™s just perfect! Died and gone to heaven kind of joint. should be added to everyoneâ€™s bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MissKimandMrE
Reviews.Content: I would first recommend anyone who is traveling to San Juan to take the Cape Air flight to Mayaguez. The drive from San Juan to Ricon is terrible (took us 4 hours) and the Cape Air flight would have been worth the extra money. Horned Dorset (â€œHDâ€�) is very difficult to find, I would suggest using a GPS to get there if you plan to drive. Anything easy to get to is not worth seeing so therefore I found the difficulty of getting to HD a bonus. I think all the other writers have put in their two cents and I can honestly say I agree it is one of the most beautiful resorts I have visited. I loved the staff, Ramon is not only good looking but very charming and the rest of the staff is extremely kind and helpful. We had a garden view room which was very nice, private and I loved the dipping pool. If there is one thing I can recommend is that the website does not put into context the beauty of this hotel. The video is very nice, but not easy to understand if you have not visited. I was shocked on how amazing the resort was and thought the hotel was better than what they publish on the internet. Defiantly will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: jdjcbc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two glorious nights at the Horned Dorset Primavera, as an impromptu summer getaway. Yes, the hotel is expensive, but that's just because it offers perfect, luxurious accommodations. Private dipping pool, kitchen, two floors, ocean-front - the works!! I cannot overstate how much I loved my stay at the Horned Dorset. The staff was friendly and professional, and the bed was exquisite. Honestly, if you're considering the Horned Dorset, don't hesitate. We're native to Puerto RIco, and have stayed a various hotels all over the island. This is by far the best we've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Steph127
Reviews.Content: How do I even begin to do justice to this little piece of heaven in Puerto Rico. It is one of the most incredible places we have ever found and had the pleasure of staying at! This place is unique, the service and the food is out of this world! The rooms are incredible; upon entering you are overwhelmed with a sense of amazement. They are luxurious and the attention to detail is unbelievable! We feel so in love with the Horned Dorset Primavera we decided to have our wedding there. Our family and friends continue to say it was the best wedding ever at the most romantic location possible. They all have said they would go back again to stay at this paradise. I know this sounds clichÃ© but the staff there really did make our wedding dream come true; it was even more then we could have ever imagined! If you are hesitating or have any doubts about staying at the Horned Dorset just stop thinking about it and book your trip; I can assure you will have no regrets. At the end of your trip you feel like you are leaving friends you have visited rather than just another hotel. We truly miss them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, ok beach, and dirty common areas”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: MY HOTEL REVIEW # 179 Horned Dorset MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the â€œwowâ€� experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Great. Right on the beach but 15 mins by car to other restaurants. We were told you could walk along the beach for 90 minutes to another restaurant but this walk is not pleasant. The beach isnâ€™t very attractive an there are tons of rocks with no sand making the journey not so fun. We turned around after about 7 minutes of walking. TYPE OF ROOM: â€¨â€¨Ocean Front Residence BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Bed is very soft (perhaps a bit too soft for me). The linens are outstanding and the pillows are down and very comfortable. LIGHTING: Tons of lighting in the room. The difficulty is trying to figure out which switch goes to the light you want to light/turn off. BATHROOM/SHOWER: The shower is gorgeous. All marble and huge. 3 showerheads and 3 additional jets made for a very fun shower experience. Water pressure can be very hard. Would have been my best shower ever if the water could have been more hot. Definitely enjoyable still but the hot water issue still exists to some extent. Bathtub is huge and great for 2 people. Water in tub was able to get very hot. TOILETRIES: Seem to be of high quality but not a brand I am familiar with. Cotton swabs are not individually wrapped so you may want to bring some clean ones from home. CLEANLINESS: ROOM: is very clean but the wood walls were very sticky from the salt water and needed to be clean. The windows were way past their cleaning time as well as it reminded me of a window you would see on a very old boat in salt water thatâ€™s been neglected. COMMON AREA: Filthy. I have never stayed in a nice resort that everywhere you looked was in need of major cleaning. The hotel appeared to have been shut down for 10 years and just reopened the day we arrived. Every outdoor light had many dead bugs in them. All walking paths need mopping or steam cleaning. Beach had tiny bit of trash that clearly had been there for a while. Loungers by the beach and on our private pool area were dirty and nearly all chair cushions outside of our room had stains. Linens used for the outside tables were dirty and the (at one time nice quality) napkins were stained. If you actually looked at areas for uncleanliness, you would find it absolutely everywhere outside of the rooms. This was not dirt from a few days of no cleaning, it is clear that this place hadnâ€™t been cleaned in a long time. Iâ€™m so glad the rooms were cleaned well or we would have left a day earlier (this discussion did happen regardless) of our 2 night stay. Our last day we noticed that the garden view room area was much more impressive (as I believe it is newer) and much cleaner. A/C: Worked well both upstairs and downstairs. CLOSET SPACE: Closet has no doors and would not be enough for two people to unpack. The iron and ironing board can be seen from the bed. STYLE OF ROOM: Excellent. Moorish design, 2 levels, beautiful iron spiral staircase. Loved it. Did think there is a bit too much furniture and chotchkies. There are 12 lamps just upstairs. In the kitchen part of the room, the cleaning supplies were in plain view (mop, broom, bucket, etc). COMMON AREA: Iâ€™ve already discussed how filthy this place is. In addition, the place could use some painting as there is very noticeable rust on our balcony pillars. The pathways are lined with lights but one of perhaps every 5 lights are out and many have the wrong type of bulb so they look awkward. The umbrellas in the breakfast area are very dirty and the chairs and tables are in a gravel area which has no aesthetic appeal. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Our room was very quiet and we could block all morning light with the shutters. FOOD: Breakfast was very good so we had high hopes for dinner. The appetizers were $15 and entrees were $30-$45. The restaurant is definitely stuffy for a beach hotel but if the food was good, we wouldnâ€™t care about this. The food disappointed. The soup was equivalent to boxed soup we buy at the store. The lobster had the wrong consistency and little flavor, the crab cakes were mediocre. However the scallops appetizer was outstanding. These were all appetizers and we decided to leave the restaurant to eat elsewhere as we left hungry. At these prices, we would have accepted good, but just ok isnâ€™t good enough. TV/INTERNET: Didnâ€™t use the TV that is only available in the residences (not suites). Internet is at no charge and of average speed (upload speed may be the slowest I have experienced outside of Burma). SERVICE: Everyone here is very nice. Typically we would have to try to locate someone to get service and there is nothing that was truly done that was extraordinary. We would see lots of staff in areas not accessible to guests and I always wondered why they werenâ€™t cleaning the common areas as opposed to engaging in conversations among themselves. SUMMARY: Not worth the price. We were very kindly upgraded to a residence ocean front room from our resident garden view room. This made the difference and is the only reason why we didnâ€™t check out early. The room is amazing. The beach is not attractive with water that was the same color as back in California (although the sun was never really out). At these prices, there are so many other places that will have equivalent rooms with clean common areas and a nice beach. I would recommend this place only if they cleaned and reduced prices substantially. Anyone used to the finest of hotels & service will be disappointed but those that travel less may leave here being impressed (reason for the mixed reviews). I donâ€™t recommend this hotel and I would skip Rincon altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but watch out for the "hidden fees" and shoddy service”
Reviews.Author: Paul_NYC_10
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely property, but not worth the price- especially with the $120 daily "resort fee" that comes at the end. Upon checking out I noticed that this $120.00 fee was added to my already expensive room rate. While it explained to me that this fee was noted in the "fine print" of my contract, it still feels very much like a "cheat." Also, the service was not up to par. While the room comes with a coffee maker, the hotel couldn't come up with a pot to boil tea. Come on guys. For an extra $120 a day you can certainly find a tea kettle. With all the other options available in other parts of the island I would not stay here again and I certain could not recommend this property to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved”
Reviews.Author: badjaws
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome approximately 20 minute ride from airport. Plenty of greenery mango trees. Good equipment in exercise room with good size pool in the same location. Plenty of exercise walking the many stairs but this is necessary after such delightful breakfast, lunch, dinners and delicious wines. We walked for hours early mornings along the beach before breakfast. We also met Mia and four friends for these walks, it was so relaxing. We occupied a two level suite with our own plunge pool, which over looked the beach with full ocean view. There's no other place we would have wanted to spend my honeymoon. My husband collect fresh fruit from the native trees each morning and the bartender made breakfast drinks how refreshing. We located a local shop with in four minutes of the hotel while walking the trail way. Having two separate baths on each level a woman couldn't have asked for more. Only regret "Wished we had more days and should have sent in our review much sooner". This hotel is certainly at the top of our recommendation. Not far from shopping outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and in need of updating, repainting, etc. for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: tml7betty
Reviews.Content: The location was beautiful and our time relaxing during our stay, but for a 5 star hotel and a hefty price we were dissapointed. I would advise against the meal plan. When we booked the trip we were not told that the Aaron, the 5 star restaurant was only open 3 of the 5 nights we stayed there. The food was excellent, which saved the trip and the restaurant staff wonderful, but we way overpayed for the other restaurant. The manager would not let us cancel the meal plan even when my husband was sick one night and didn't have dinner or breakfast the next night. The hotel rooms were beautiful, nut in need of a paint job and we had ants in our downstairs bathroom...not quite the 5 star treatment we paid for. The staff did help us with our bags the first day, but the morning of checkout there was no offer, my husband was ill, and over 5 staff members so kindly said good morning to me, but didn't offer to help me lug bags to our car. The lovely views, warm weather, and good food saved our vacation, but would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this beautiful hotel. Total...”
Reviews.Author: lolita131313
Reviews.Content: Love this beautiful hotel. Total relaxation. Old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: jjacketti
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous hotels worldwide, and the Dorset is at the top of the list in luxury, service, accommodations and location. A true 5 star hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and Sublime Getaway”
Reviews.Author: patentmaven
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a two-story suite at the Horned Dorset Primavera in mid-March, 2010. The experience was heavenly. This is a very sophisticated, very upscale, not inexpensive getaway. Although children are welcome, it is likely not the type of place that would appeal to families with youngsters. One of my favorite aspects was a welcome letter advising that the "hotel has no planned activities." Although you can arrange day outings and in-room massages, the main activity is pure relaxation. This is a place to bring your books and your sunscreen and simply get away from the world. There are no tv's, and I'm almost embarassed to say that I took my laptop to the lobby a few times to access the hotel's wi-fi to check e-mail for an essential work-related project. The hotel has its own private beach and several beautiful pools. The staff, led by Mr. Sack, provide European style assistance -- they don't hover but are absolutely delightful and knowledgeable and ready to assist the minute you ask for anything. Our suite was beautifully decorated with mahogany furniture and an amazingly comfortable canopied four-poster bed on the second floor. Each suite has its own plunge pool and private balcony. The food, especially at Aaron, the more formal of the hotel's two restaurants, was wonderful (note: the formal restaurant is open only Wed-Sun). The night we arrived at the hotel, we learned that a special concert by a quintet of chamber music players was about to begin in the Restaurant Aaron. We dashed to our room, changed out of our casual travel clothes, and somehow made it to the concert on time. A wonderful dinner followed the concert. We must have been a last-minute addition, but the hotel managed to give us a prime table only about ten feet away from the musicians. It was one of those surprising, truly memorable evenings that we'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days here over Valentine's weekend. We really thought it was a beautiful and relaxing place to stay. The suite was gorgeous , we stayed in the Horned Dorset residences , probably one of the most beautiful rooms I've stayed in , and I've stayed in a LOT of 5 star hotels. I would stay here again. I thought the room was pricy before I stayed there, but it really is worth it. We had a beautiful private pool. There were only a few things that could have been improved in my opinion. One was the hot water issue that other reviewers have commented on. We did have a problem the first day we were there and it was frustrating after a very long travel day not to be able to take a hot shower when we arrived. We were told by the manager and others that we had to leave the water running for a long time. We never got hot water in the upstairs shower , even if we ran it for 20 minutes. ( What a shame with such a beautiful shower !! ) We did get nice hot water in the downstairs shower , after running it for 10 minutes, and you have to turn the gauge to "cold" which is confusing. Other minor caveats. Housekeeping did not service our room the first day , we had to ask 3 times and they turned up at 7:30 at night as we were trying to get ready for dinner. The food was very good for breakfast and lunch. We were not impressed with the food at Aarons or the Blue Room , but the service was excellent. Especially the french female waiter. One other thing. The AC in the bedroom was so loud ! When it turned on it woke us up. Shame since the beds were so comfortable and delicious ! It would have been nice to have more beach service. It was hard to get someone to bring you a drink or lunch on the beach. Luckily I had a very handsome husband that went and got everything for me I needed.

Reviews.Title: “A stay at a hotel managed by Mr. Wilhelm Sack is a "bucket list" must”
Reviews.Author: willowbarcelona
Reviews.Content: Over the past 20+ years I have been fortunate to enjoy the luxury that a vacation in a Wilhelm Sack managed hotel bestows upon guests. This past November I went to The Horned Dorset Primavera by myself over a 5-day Thanksgiving holiday. Normally, when traveling alone I venture to Europe or to locations where sight-seeing is a priority. But this Thanksgiving called out for a beach, some books, quiet and tranquility. I knew that because Mr. Sack was the MaÃ®tre de Maison of the Horned Dorset that I would be pampered, that I would not for one second feel awkward at my solo status, and that Mr. Sack and his staff would ensure I had fun. The wonderful thing about trusting someone of Mr. Sack's experience and talents is that the level of welcome, service, and comfort is consistently the highest. Mr. Sack knows his guests and never forgets a name or a face. He and his superior staff make their hard work seem effortless as every need is attended to even before one knows one wishes it. For instance, the staff knew how much I enjoy an early morning before-breakfast swim and immediately offered to have a pot of coffee resting beside a beach lounge chair when I emerged from the water. It is this kind of individualized service that is a hallmark of Wilhelm Sack managed hotel. And in his assistant general manager, Ramon Serrano MontÃ¡s, Mr. Sack has found someone who also makes the guestsâ€™ comfort his highest priority. The cares of the world fall away at The Horned Dorset and much of the reason for that also is attributable to the remarkable Chef Aaron Wratten and his capable and inventive kitchen staff and welcoming wait staff. Local fish and produce abound, served exquisitely to show off their just-caught and just-picked freshness. The hotelâ€™s superb location on the western side of the island allows one to drive through what had been sugar plantation country. An indigenous extensive mango grove extends for miles along one of the roads. In fact, The Horned Dorset keeps on hand a list of the botanicals found on the property created by the Director of the New York Botanical Garden. The Horned Dorset Primavera is for the true traveler, for the traveler who appreciates that it is the deft skill of a hotelâ€™s general manager that establishes the greatest hotels as legends. The Horned Dorset Primavera already has achieved legendary status thanks to Mr. Sack and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: efren
Reviews.Content: Very few times does anything surpass your expectations, but this hotel does just that. From the moment we walked through it's big dark wooden gates, we stepped into Shangri-la. It is heaven on earth. Tranquil, private, luxurious and all with taste. There are no TV or radios and phones are hidden away. It's a place to relax, recharge and leave the world behind. All other reviews go into specifics, so I'll avoid that part. Let me add that I grew up in Ponce and didn't know this place was on the island. Now, any time I go back, I'll make sure to visit it again. It was one of those experiences that you'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular and beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: DZ-Jay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from staying at the Horned Dorset and we find that words cannot give justice to the wonderful experience we had. We stayed for four nights and, being off-season for the resort, we received an amazingly low rate for a villa (compared to their seasonal rates). On top of this, on arrival we were upgraded to a full ocean view villa, which blew our minds: two stories of beautifully decorated, clean and wonderfully set living space, with a fantastic four-post bed, and a spectacular 170-degree view of the ocean right at our balcony, surrounded by beautiful trees. It also had a small, secluded terrace with a private pool. Every day our stock of complimentary bottled water (sparkling or still, depending on your preference) in the suite would be replenished, and when we come back from dinner we would find our bed turned down and all bedroom windows closed for the night, which was a nice touch. Waking up to the beautiful RincÃ³n sunrise, with birds chirping and the ocean waves rumbling was a wonderful experience. (And this comes from a Puertorrican--I grew up in the Island and I'm used to its charms, yet the Horned Dorset still managed to impress and surprise me.) Being off-season, the resort was minimally staffed, but all present went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant and special as possible. The hotel restaurant served classic french cuisine with a touch of caribbean flair, and the chef even accommodated a special request to have chicken one night when it wasn't in the menu. It was succulent and delicious, and beautifully presented in spite of the short notice. The service was impeccable, and the entire staff was warm and friendly, and at a great disposition to serve us. Our only complaint, as others have mentioned, was that there appears to be no hot water. We were told to leave the water running for a few minutes--and we did, at times up to 30 minutes!--but it never got entirely hot, just slightly more than lukewarm. I don't know if this is due to cost-savings during the off-season, or if there really is an issue with the heating system; but in any case it is something that should be easily addressed with proper equipment and maintenance. That said, this very small detail did not affect at all our enjoyment of the place, nor will it influence in any way our decision in the future to return or recommend the resort, which we will do without question. All in all, it was a wonderful, relaxing experience, and we are definitely coming back to the Horned Dorset. Perhaps someday even during its high season. -dZ.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DCHArtist123
Reviews.Content: This place was exactly what we needed. Rented two suites for myself and family and could not be happier. It is beautiful, the place tranquil and the staff INCREDIBLE. We were only there for two days, and only tried the restaurant for breakfast, so worth it. I cannot wait to come back. It was such an incredibly wonderful place to stay, away from the typical touristy spots in San Juan. It is the only way to enjoy the real Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but more attention to details needed”
Reviews.Author: lishaana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to the Horned Dorset as part of a 9 day trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed for 2 nights. Once we arrived, we were upgraded to a Residence from a seaside Primavera Suite, as the resort was pretty empty(it was in the off-season). The Residence was gorgeously appointed. We had TV and internet and a Kitchenette. We also had great views. The restaurant Chef Aaron's was superb(we ate all our meals there). It was a secluded and romantic setting. Unfortunately, the resort itself seemed a little neglected. Our plunge pool was dirty with leaves and debris and the filtration system didn't work. The white cushions on many of the loungers were dirty (including the ones in our deck). The hot water was an issue as it took 10 minutes to get hot water and during peak times(in the AM and late afternoon)- hot water was no where to be found. I believe our residence was the farthest from the water heater. I would recommend they invest in a tankless water heaters for each residence, they are energy efficient and don't take up much space and never run out of hot water. The gym, while well-equipped, had no A/C. The units are there but they don't work!. I lasted about 30 minutes before I had to leave the gym. That is just unacceptable. The gym is useless without air-conditioning. There is little service in any of the public places like the pool. They don't even mention that they have bottled water for you at the pool. We found it by accident. For this price, they need to have at least someone to bring you water and or beverages or at least a poolside bar for you to get it yourself. The beach is small, but acceptable. This place has a lot of potential... If they spend as much effort of maintenance/service and details as they do on the rooms and decor. This place would be top-notch if they addressed these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular place, period.”
Reviews.Author: kelting
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Horned Dorset Primavera for the second time last spring, and were once again made to feel like "secret celebrities". The hotel has just finished an upgrade of some rooms, and the one in which we were fortunate enough to stay for 3 nights can best be described as Arabian Nights on the Caribbean. It was a 2-level suite featuring Moorish-style decor, which might sound a little over the top, but was in fact breathtakingly gorgeous. (It did take us a while to figure out the light switches, tho). The food was, as before, wonderful, and the property's amenities encourage utter relaxation; 3 beautiful pools (in addition to numerous private pools) and a perfect little beach, which we spent our 2 days just inhabiting. There is no night life to speak of, other than a leisurely dinner, but that's exactly what we were looking for. That said, all of this comes at a price; even with an incentive package, this place is not a bargain. Even the lowest-price rooms are fairly expensive, though they're all gorgeous. Add to this the price of a rental car (Rincon is on the western end of P.R. and about a 2 1/2 hour drive from the airport - the hotel will pick you up, but again, at a price, and then you're stuck there), and you're talking real money. But for a special trip, the Primavera is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing private paradise”
Reviews.Author: manina59
Reviews.Content: I'm a middle age woman, who was searching for a quiet, private, relaxing and secure hotel or resort.. My experience was superb. I got all I was looking for, and more. A huge two levels suite, a private small pool, an absolute quietness so relaxing that the only sounds I've heard were from nature.. Tip: Food is great but really expen$$$ive. If you can't afford it, look for a map on a gas station and drive around the towns of Rincon, AÃ±asco and Mayaguez, each one pretty closed one to another and 30 minutes away from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We're booking a second stay”
Reviews.Author: kookoom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first three nights of our honeymoon at The Horned Dorset. Well, we booked only two nights initially but once Hector had us settled, we said almost simultaneously, "We're staying an extra night, right?" Not only did they upgrade us to a sea view (on a cliff to boot) for our honeymoon, but they had chilled champagne from my sister-in-law and most importantly, a bottle of JD displayed right in the entryway, ordered by my friend. We laughed upon seeing this (OK, I'm a redneck so....) but Wilhem, the owner, said, "What you want is what you get. Anything is possible at The Horned Dorset." We're trying to get back in July/August. I'm already trying to think of an outrageous/obnoxious request and I guarantee they'll fill it within the hour! Kenna and John M RIP Miss Piggy and miss Jefrey

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: FarVoyager
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted a vacation where we could get away from it all and yet be treated with first class service -- the Horned Dorset delivered both counts! The hotel occupies a quiet, private beach near the small town of Rincon. Each suite is large and designed to produce as much privacy as possible. On many occasions, we felt as if we were there all by ourselves -- just what we wanted. Don't worry, though, there is plenty of staff for whatever you need. The Horned Dorset seems to follow a European approach to good service: the staff remain as quiet and low-key as possible but, as soon as you ask for something, they promptly meet your request. All of it adds to the sense of quiet luxury. Beyond the relaxing privacy, we were delighted to discover that the food there is excellent. As other reviewers will tell you: sign up for their meal plan -- it proves to be a bargain. Their chef trained at an award winning restaurant in New York City and it really shows. Moreover, they have a wonderful and dedicated bartender, Pedro, who makes one of the best Mojitos I've ever had. If you feel like venturing out, a rental car is a must. The winding roads of are a bit overwhelming at first, but the local drivers are fairly patient. Some places to try: the Banana Dang, the English Rose, the tapas bar at the Casa Islena hotel, and the sushi at the Pools bar. All in all, we left the Horned Dorset feeling extremely relaxed and refreshed, ready for the frantic pace of NYC. In sum: If you're looking for a really active vacation, the Horned Dorset is probably not for you. But, if you're looking for a classy romantic getaway or a really relaxing weekend with a friend, the Horned Dorset is quite the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: SunFunSun
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try to write this with just the facts I encountered, but I must admit, this just wasn't my (and hubby's) type of place. We do high-end here and there, but this wasn't special enough for us to pay $350+++++++++/night. We stayed 3 nights in a garden view suite. Two-story suite was beautifully decorated in the mediterranean style furniture, but I learned that means "uncomfortable" furniture. Plenty of chairs and couches, but none you can get comfy in. I am a meeting planner by day, so you would think I would be well aware of the property I was going to. I knew there was no internet service, but somehow I missed that there were no TVs nor alarm clocks. Since there's not much to do in Rinocn late at night, a TV is really needed unless you are early to bed which we are not. As for the alarm clock, not really an issue other than I like to know what time it is if I wake up during the night. When one of the staff was in our suite fixing the safe (very fast service), I asked about the alarm clock. He said they offer wake up service. I had only found one phone in my few hours there and it was on the first floor, while the bed was on the second. I confirmed this with the man and he said they offer a courtesy door knock for wake up. Again, the door is on the first floor. I don't sleep that soundly, but since the A/C unit sounded like a jet engine (this is actually a plus to me), I doubt I'd hear the phone or the knock if I needed it. We just used our cell phone alarm on check out day. The A/C worked on and off. We found that if it started getting oddly hot, we shut it off for 5 minutes, turned it back on and then it was fine. This worked for our 3 nights, so we never reported a problem. Mosquitos, I agee, are bad, so bring bug spray and something for the itchy bites. The weather was very hot for us with no breeze, so being at any pool was not an option the first day. The beach was nice with plenty of chairs and great ocean swimming. No one around to ask questions of, but we got by just finelooking around for ourselves. On the second day, we were able to sit by a pool and were alone most of the time which was nice (it's off season now). We ventured out to lunch each day to see Rincon which is very different than the HD. When we got back, the sun was on our dipping pool, so we hung out there each afternoon. THIS WAS AWESOME!!!! Granted, we could see our neighbors' dipping pool on either side of us if we walked out on our grass (photo opportunities in the gardens) and they never had sun in their "backyard" area. We lucked out. We spoke to another couple in an oceanview room and they said their pool was pretty dirty from leaves from the trees, but we lucked out again in that area. The hotel advertises that they serve "tapas" each evening at 6:30. That would be singluar (one) tapas. When another guest was having drinks on the balcony the same night as us asked the waiter what was in the "dip' he put out (man was allergic to shell fish), the waiter said he was pretty sure it wasn't shell fish that is was fish. (yes, that is what he said several times). I was shocked the waiter never went to find out what was in it, but the man ate it and lived to tell about it. Though it was nice to sit on the balcony at sunset, you may want to look at the balcony from the beach before you stand on the balcony. It is going to come crashing down any day now. Let me know when you see the rubble as hubby and I have bets on when it will be. As for my reference in the start of this to $350+++++++++++, the pluses are all the charges. There is a fee for general services on top of the room rate which is maid service, beach towels, free water bottles, etc. Again, I missed knowing about this charge until I made my reservation. Our confirmation indicated it was 12%. We were charged 15%. When we showed the reception person our confirmation, they did adjust it and explained it just went up to 15%. If you booked a while ago, you may want to keep an eye out for this if you want an accurate bill. As for reception, they are open 8am-10pm. If you happen to check in later than that (as we did), you are on your own. Key is at the reception and security showed us to our room. Thank goodness we were close to the reception area. Many rooms are down very steep, uneven stairs, so I couldn't imagine carrying our luggage ourselves as would be the case late at night. I assume there are bellman for that during normal hours, but don't know for sure. Yes, there are roosters, but they weren't near my room luckily. Each floor of the room has glass doors with beautiful wood shutters to close at night. Unfortunately, if you like it dark for sleeping, there are small windows above each door on both floors that let a ton of light in all night long. The fitness center was pretty good. We did not dine there even though everyone raved of the food, we wanted to get out and about in Rincon (go to Shipwreck if you want to dine out). Food ran about $30-$45 per entree at the hotel restaurant. Lunch menu was about $15 for a burger. All pretty normal for a high end resort, but so unnecessary in Rincon. Dogs are everywhere in Rincon, so being at the hotel seems reasonable. They didn't seem to bother anyone, but since we didn't eat there, I am not sure. Bed was great, linens, towels, bath tissues, etc - all great! It would take just a little bit extra for this place to be fabulous. I wouldn't go back for these prices and rooms just off the mark. We saw so many villa rentals that seemed the way to go for a beachfront stay for our next stay in Rincon - which we loved!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sandreckoner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for our honeymoon after spending a weekend in Old San Juan. We stayed for four nights in one of the Horned Dorset Residences right on the beach. Let me start with the good and move towards the disappointing. Our residence was very large and, to my tastes anyhow, was very well furnished. We had two stories with the master bedroom on top and the living room (plus guest bed) below. I enjoyed the space, the Moorish design and decorations, as well as the size of our small private pool. The residence even comes with a kitchen replete with stove, fridge, microwave, and espresso maker (though, oddly, no ordinary coffee maker or kettle for tea--nor any pots or pans so that you could actually use the stove). When all was at its best, it could begin to feel like I owned my own well appointed condo on the west coast of Puerto Rico. In fact, I think the hotel is trying to find purchasers for the residences with some kind of lease-back agreement. Three more quick high points before we get to the bad: (1) We really enjoyed the food. We ate most of our meals at the Horned Dorset, and I do not regret it. There is definitely enough variety to eat every meal and keep eating different things for four or five days. (That said, unless you're going to eat a lot, I recommend against the meal plan, since for us it ended up making no financial sense). (2) The beach is very pretty, and, despite what some reviewers have claimed, it is indeed possible and even enjoyable to swim in the water. (3) Some of the staff are really nice. We love Pedro's piÃ±a coladas. Now let's move to the disappointments, shall we? (A) No Cancha Del Cielo. As of May 2009, the HDP website still claims there is a tennis court, the "Cancha Del Cielo" (or "Court of the Heavens") with a "spectacular view". I eagerly packed our tennis gear. When we arrived, we were told the court no longer exists, but that the hotel could arrange for tennis in MayagÃ¼ez. I have three words for that: bait and switch. (B) No hot water. For the first two nights of the stay, we had no hot water. From what I can tell, a number of the residences were without hot water for those nights. What use is the gorgeous bathtub you see in the pictures from other reviews when you have nothing to fill it with? The hotel offered to put us in another room, but one that was otherwise not nearly as nice (no internet, no TV, quite a bit smaller), all for the bargain of $770 per night instead of $880. (C) Mosquitos, lots and lots of mosquitos. In a four day period, I killed about 30 of them IN OUR ROOM. I could never keep them out, even after it seemed to me I had killed them all. There are also usually lizards and dogs roaming around the property. We generally like dogs, though the ones here urgently needed a bath. (D) Rocks and Sea Urchins. Though you can swim off the beach in front of the hotel, and though the beach is pretty and the water is lovely, DO NOT step on the rocks in the water. I accidentally stepped on a sea urchin and ended up with several spines in my foot. Do you know what you're supposed to do when you step on a sea urchin? Soak your foot in hot water. Whoops: See Disappointment (B). Wait, I have a Residence, can't I heat water on the stove? Oops: No pots. In fairness to the hotel, after we explained all of this to them they put an electric hotpot in our room. I hope for the sake of future guests they leave it there. I'll end the review with some rapid fire tidbits I think might be useful to people. *Our gadgets worked. All of our gadgets worked just fine in our room, including an iPhone, a Blackberry, and a Kindle. The phone in the room seemed to be a little on the fritz, so it was good that our phones were fine. * TV and internet connection in the room worked without any problems or difficult set up. * They have kayaks for one person but no double kayaks as of May 2009. Their double kayaks were stolen or broken or something. Kind of a downer for couples. * While staff are friendly, sometimes they can be hard to find. You end up walking around the clubhouse or beach gazebo just looking for people. It's kind of a hands-off experience, which is generally good but maybe taken a little too far at the moment. If I were to come back, I would be lulled back chiefly by the size and Moorish decoration of the residence and the food from the restaurant. What's more likely is that on my next trip to Puerto Rico, I'll go hunting for prettier places on the east coast.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing. Not the high end resort I was expecting. Relais et Chateaux....Really?”
Reviews.Author: howardjerr
Reviews.Content: The drive from San Juan was painful. As we approached the hotel, I thought we must be in the wrong place. We passed piles of trash along the side of the road, complete with an old appliance. Entrance was not impressive. There were dogs running loose. I had to ask for someone to help with the luggage. The grounds were pretty much "au naturale." Clearly, there were no landscapers on staff. The room was spacious, but looked dated and smelled dated too. The air conditioner was noisy as hell. There was no TV and no Internet access. The plunge pool needed cleaned and serviced. I got in the plunge pool once and decided that was enough. The view from the room was the nicest part. A lot of deferred maintenance in the room, as well as the resort in general. The gym: What a joke!; No A/C; Very little equipment; No towels; No disinfectant; Plenty of dust; etc. We used the gym once and decided that was enough. There is one restaurant and one bar. The bar is only partially stocked. Don't think you are going to get any exotic drinks here! For dinner, the restaurant is semi-formal. We were rejected for wearing shorts the first night (even though this is a beach vacation and the restaurant was completely empty). Be careful ordering wine. I don't think they have a wine storage unit. All red wine will be served at room temp (and this is Puerto Rico room temp). The food was generally good. The beach is as small as it appears in the picture. No service on the beach. The water, however, was heavenly. There is absolutely nothing to do in Rincon. If you go to this resort, that's it. Don't count on going out for dinner anywhere other than the hotel. The resort had very little staff, probably because it had very little business. We felt as though there were only a handful of other guests. Hardly ran into anyone else. This resort is either well passed its prime, or is trying to be something it is not. At these room rates (or any rate for that matter), I would say pass. Clearly not what I expected from a Relais et Chateaux. We left after 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat!”
Reviews.Author: dcc524
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Horned Dorset to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It's a perfect getaway, and oh so romantic! Stayed at the Cliffside Suites, ours was a Partial View (# 49) - 2 story villa, 2 marble bathrooms, plunge pool, day bed, balconies, and a 4 poster canopy bed that was heavenly. The service at reception was very nice. Likewise, the staff is friendly, visible and pay attention to detail - something you don't see everywhere. Aaron's Restaurant was fantastic - very gourmet food and excellent service. As for the location - the property is situated on the quiet part of Rincon (mainly known for surfing beaches). This beach is completly calm...yet you can still hear softly crashing waves at night. Very nice. The hotel is on a hillside, so have in mind there will be stairs. It's what I expect from a Relais & Chateaux with the added bonus of being in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: ljbbest
Reviews.Content: I should start out by saying that I am a spoiled traveler who usually stays at a Four Seasons so I expect the very best. That being said, the Horned Dorset wasn't bad. Even though it was in season, there were very few people there. We practically had the pools, mealtimes to ourselves. The room was amazing - it was a garden view suite - 2 floors, amazing canopied bed (the best I've ever slept in), 2 large bathrooms, 2 small balconies on the top floor and a terrace on the ground floor with a dipping pool. In my opinion, some of their problems are: there are many stray dogs all over the property - under your dining table etc., their more casual restaurant was closed so for dinner you could only eat in the formal dining room - while you'll read that others rave about their food, it is very expensive and NOT at all special. The private dipping pool was not heated - none of their pools are heated - kind of annoying, the beaches are narrow and not very nice. There is no service - nobody comes around to ask you if you want a drink (I don't like to be doted on but you definitely notice when you are not being catered to). When an employee noticed that you needed something, they were very nice. We ended up renting a car to drive to the Maria's beach area to look at the surf and hang around Calypso restaurant and outside bar and eat there a couple of evenings to get a different meal and to be around more people. My boyfriend is a surfer but the waves were just way to big even for him and you have to paddle out very far to get to them. Keep that in mind if you are looking for a surfing vacation. The grounds need to be manicured and the pools cleaned. It just isn't up to a great resort level but the rooms are wonderful. It is hard to compete with the Four Seasons!
