Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort -- Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl8
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in RIncon staying at the Horned Dorset. The villas here are very luxurious and well appointed and we felt very pampered. We did the meal plan one day we were there and really enjoyed the breakfast and dinner. I am not sure I would do the dinner again. It was a nice experience that I enjoyed, but once was enough. The breakfast was great and if I came again I might get it every day. We enjoyed eating it by the ocean and it was delicious. The Horned Dorset doesn't have a great beach, but the property is lovely and well-cared for and there are many beaches nearby. The view from our room was wonderful. This is a very pricey resort, but we felt it was worth it for a few days. I wouldn't want to stay longer than that. There is more to see in Puerto Rico. The staff was very helpful and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: In looking for a romantic wintertime escape, I had narrowed my choices down to Nisbet Plantation on Nevis and the Horned Dorset Primavera. Due to ease of travel to Puerto Rico, the Horned Dorset won out for this particular trip. After spending the night in San Juan, we made the relatively straightforward drive to Rincon, via toll and local roads. Once off the toll road, the pace slows; the closer we got to our destination, the narrower and twistier the roads got. Here, with smaller towns, less population, and more livestock (especially those dratted roosters who donâ€™t know light from dark), I felt weâ€™d finally arrived in the Caribbean. At last, we drove through the gated driveway of The Horned Dorset. One thing Iâ€™ve learned through many years of travel is to manage expectations, because expectations that are too high are often dashed. Nevertheless, everything Iâ€™d seen or heard about The Horned Dorset led me to think we were in for a superlative experience, so I placed myself at risk of disappointment. This time, however, my high expectations were exceeded. Simply put, the Horned Dorset Primavera is one of the most exquisite places Iâ€™ve ever visited. The resort is sited on a luxuriantly landscaped hillside that slides into the surf, with a small, protected beachfront. Iâ€™d booked a garden view â€œPrimavera Suite,â€� which had a foliage-obstructed view of the sea from our balconies. The suite, in a whitewashed building containing two suites, was 1,400 square feet on two levels. The first level featured an expansive living area decorated in Mediterranean style, small kitchen decked out in rare blue granite, and a marble-clad bath with shower. Two sets of french doors gave out to a greenery-screened private terrace complete with our own dipping pool. Upstairs, we had a huge bedroom and sitting area, equipped with a giant four-poster bed draped in mosquito netting, and an even more sybaritic full bath. One set of french doors opened onto a small Juliet balcony, with another two sets of doors opening onto a larger balcony. The fittings and fixtures included oriental rugs, wrought-iron chandeliers, and mahogany furnishings. For the time we spent at the Horned Dorset, we ranged between our own terrace, self-contained as it was; the beachfront, which is largely protected from the wind but can sport some rough surf; and the infinity-edge pool adjacent to our building. We were here for togetherness, sun, and warmth and didnâ€™t need much more. In the late afternoon, weâ€™d have sundowners on our terrace, before proceeding on to dinner. Our first night, we had dinner at the on-site Restaurant Aaron (as opposed to the more casual bistro-styled Blue Room). We splurged and ordered the multi-course tasting menu, having been assured that despite nearly a dozen courses, we would not need to be hauled out in wheelbarrows. What we got was a dozen little tastes of the chefâ€™s best offerings, enough to tantalize and satisfy (e.g. a single perfect scallop, or a demitasse of soup), but not so much as to overwhelm. From rabbit sausage to Kahlua soufflÃ©, it was just perfect. Service was lovely and friendly, though I suspect some of our well-dressed servers are surfer dudes by day. After our first night, we only ate on-site for one other meal â€“ a lovely oceanfront dinner at the Blue Room. Though we enjoy fine dining, we like local food and establishments even better, especially when traveling. So we enjoyed venturing off-property, having found the laid-back beach bars (often recommended by hotel staff) much to our liking. For our purposes, Rincon and The Horned Dorset Primavera delivered what we were looking for in a romantic wintertime escape. Our main goals were to find warm weather, a secluded seaside setting, luxurious accommodations, and fine dining (when we wanted it). That we could leave the gates of our hotel and enter into a funky, laid-back beach town made it all the more appealing.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: hotelcollector
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to truly relax on your vacation, this is the place to go. This is especially true if you are looking to avoid long flights, etc. Getting there from here (NC) consisted of a three-hour flight and a three-hour, easy drive from San Juan to Rincon. (I believe that Jet Blue flies into Aguadilla, which means one would have only a twenty-minute drive.) We spent a few fun nights in Old San Juan before arriving at the Horned Dorset for a five-night stay. Everything was perfect: the rooms are large, beautiful, and clean; the grounds are magnificent, the beach is small, but excellent for lounging, the pools are gorgeous, and the service was unlimited and friendly. Also, I should mention that the food was consistently outstanding (which is a good thing, because there really aren't too many other great options within driving distance.) After a few days here, I felt incredibly refreshed. Worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic With Beautiful Rooms, Highly Customized and Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: PPinkberry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending New Year's at the Horned Dorset. We stayed at the Residences which are right by the water's edge (just a few feet) with private plunge pool and garden. The Residences also have TV and internet. This was probably one of our most relaxing and private vacations. And for that, we have the hotel staff and mangement to thank especially General Manager Wilhem Sacks and Assistant Manager Ramon Serrano. They were both on top of everything and dealing with any issues we had promptly. What makes the service here special is that its very personal and customized. Even prior to our arrival, we received a lot of personal attention from Ramon. He was very up to speed with any questions and requests we had. In October of 2008, we stayed at Sandy Lane in Barbados, another top resort in the Carribeean but we did not have the pre-arrival service that we had at the Horned Dorset. Sandy Lane was generally responsive however Horned Dorset went above and beyond to take care of us. We also stayed at the Regent Palm, Turks and Caicos in May of 2008 (skip it, this resort has no pre-arrival service and service here is automated/mass oriented). You def get the feeling that you are being looked after at the Horned Dorsett. Another point is that Mr Sacks is a part owner of this resort which explains his dedication to the hotel guests. This is not a big, mass resort that overwhelms with activity. It is a tranquil and small resort. While kayaking, swimming, snorkelling are available, it was very refreshing not to see any boats or jet skis in the water. It was lovely to be able to look out into the open unobstructed water which is quite a rare experience. Per some reviewers' comments re the beach, while it is quite small, it is secluded and has a lovely feel to it. It is never crowded which is such a treat especially over New Year's. We have been to other top resorts with powder white sand and crystal clear waters however the whole beach/pool experience was overshadowed by the crowds (Regent Palms!) especially over the New Year holidays. I personally prefer beaches that are in an enclave and protected versus ones that are very big and out in the open. On our third day, we spent the entire day on the beach. The waters are generally very calm, not too rocky and perfect for swimming. Sit near the beach attendant if you are the type that needs a lot of service. As mentioned, this is not a large resort that will overwhelm you.The attendants here do not come by with sorbet, spritzs or cold towels here. They tend to leave you alone so if you need something just ask and they will more than oblige. There is iced bottled water available so just ask for it when you want it.The infinity pool is stunning and I woud highly recommend taking a swim in it. The view is out of this world. The hotel has a lovely ambiance. Its surroundings are rustic and laidback while the accomodations are luxurious and very romantic. The Residences have a Moroccon inspired decor while the Primavera Suites have a Spanish/Mediterrnean feel. Guests that stayed at the Primavera Suites only had good things to say about it however i would strongly recommend staying in the Residences which are larger, closer to the water and have TV/internet. The breakfast and lunch area overlooking the beach is lovely yet very casual. Try the creamy gazpachio at lunch, we literally had it every day. It is also a good idea to rent a car to see some of the island. The resort is a little out of place in Rincon but that only added to the overall experience as we liked venturing out to see Rincon and returning to our lovely hotel. Whatever issues this hotel may have (hot water is not that hot, restaurant Aarons can be a bit slow), they will make up for it with their personalized service. Any issues will be dealt with immediately by management. The Manager/owner is extremely hands on and will ensure you have a good experience. The best thing about this resort (apart from the highly customized and personal service) is that special feeling/ambiance you get when you are on vacation. We loved the gorgeus two story accomodation we had with a private plunge pool only a few feet away from the water. Being so close to the water, it was a real pleasure to sleep at nite to the sound of the crashing waves. Most places in the Caribbeann are not this close to the water. There is usually a large garden between beach and the room but you are really just a few feet away at this The bedroom is ultra romantic and we now understand why so many reviewers say its the most comfortable bed they have slept in!!! We would whole heartedly agree with that. Horned Dorset is a special and tranquil place to getaway from the real world. It is a getaway from getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Horned Dorset”
Reviews.Author: choogirl39
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and seeing the Horned Dorset on the travel channel, my husband and I decided to stay here for the first two nights of a getaway to Puerto Rico. We were so glad we did! The premises are just beautiful. We booked a two story townhouse with full ocean view and it was amazing. The entire back of the townhouse was french doors that opened to the magnificent ocean below. A private plunge pool was wonderful as was the two full sized bathrooms. The king bed was a beautiful four poster and very comfortable. The kitchen had a fridge and ice maker and was stocked with bottled water. Overall, the accommodations cannot be beat. The grounds are beautiful and serene. As it was early December, we barely saw other guests and felt like we had the whole place to ourselves! It was truly an amazing experience. The staff was wonderful and the dining was delicious. We had breakfast out by the water in the morning and dinner in the beautiful restaurant Aaron in the evenings. Wonderful menus with 5 star experience! Overall, I can't praise this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “A week of relaxing BLISS at the Horned Dorset!”
Reviews.Author: JAG74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Horned Dorset November 8-15, 2008. Truly I can't imagine having a single negative thing to say about this property or our experience there . . . we are both over-worked city-dwellers and the Horned Dorset was exactly what we needed to relax and re-charge in elegant perfection. We flew direct Boston to San Juan on American and rented a car to make the trip to Rincon. This ended up being an excellent option as we were free to roam around throughout the week and venture off the property for lunch every day. We took the Southern route there (via 52) . . . about 3 hours total. We returned via the Northern route (Interstate 22) about 2.5 hours total. The Southern route is prettier, if you don't mind a little extra time. Our GPS worked in PR, which was extremely helpful, but either route is simple and direct if you're just using a normal map. When we checked in to our suite, we couldn't have been more impressed. The space is simply gorgeous, and I fear that pictures do not do it justice. The bed may have been one of the most comfortable ever, and the private patio with plunge pool was our favorite part. We had excellent afternoon sun there, and spent a good portion of every day just reading and dipping at leisure. Fantastic! The infinity pool was another favorite spot, and we often had it to ourselves. Our two-floor suite came equipped with two full bathrooms (one of the largest tubs I've ever soaked in) as well as a small little kitchen area with a fridge and ice maker. The fridge was stocked with both still and sparkling water. (We added some beer to the mix.) There were also a few books, which I loved to see as I often run out of reading material on vacation. If you were in search of more books, you could wander over to the library bar located in the building with both of the property's restaurants. We invested in the Breakfast & Dinner meal plan, so spent a great deal of quality time there. Food was fantastic and service impeccable. Breakfast is served outside with the most fantastic view of the water. Dinner at the Blue Room (a new and more casual space) is also offered al fresco in the same area. Restaurant Aaron upstairs is more elegant, romantic, and formal -- but we loved having a choice to mix up the week. And -- it has to be said -- Pedro at the bar makes the best Mojito I've ever had . . . without question. We enjoyed lunching at some of the casual beach bars throughout Rincon including Tamboo, Calypso and The Rum Shack (at The Lazy Parrot). It was fun to check out the surfer culture and live vicariously through all the folks that moved to PR to follow the waves. One mistake I would avoid â€“ we decided to make the 90 minute drive to Ponce to do a little sightseeing. Frommerâ€™s made it sound like a charming and wonderful city with great architecture, etc. DONâ€™T DO IT! If you want to see something worthwhile, block out some time for Old San Juan (which is what we will do on our return trip). Ponce was not worth the drive, especially as the well-known museum there is currently closed for renovations. Bottom line -- if you're looking for a wonderfully quiet week with great food and amazing service, the Horned Dorset is ideal. Night life can be found a few minutes down the road (specifically at Calypso), but between the sun and the food we rarely made it past 10:30 p.m. If you go, be sure to give a good scratch to one of the many dogs on the property (specifically Jeffrey -- who was our personal favorite). Many thanks to everyone on staff for a wonderful week!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spoily treat of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peponi
Reviews.Content: We spent only two nights at this hotel. Far too short! Sitting in the restaurant and bar brings an altogether new meaning to 'seafront' and the accommodation is super generous and beautifully designed. A large and beautiful bedroom with a sitting area, a massive luxurious bathroom, an even larger sitting room with a separate kitchenette, a pretty little garden and a superb mini plunge pool, I could have spent all day and all night just luxuriating in our casita but there was so much more to enjoy at this hotel: the beach, the sea, the fabulous infinity pool, the excellent service, the view from the restaurant. Staying here was a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: tokyobrave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort for our 20th wedding anniversary. After discovering late that we had allowed our passports to expire, we were reminded that Puerto Rico did not reqire passports. Since this was such a special occasion, we wanted ultra exclusivity and privacy - and boy oh boy did we find it! We flew into San Juan, rented a car, spent the night at the Intercontinental and then drove about 3 hours to Rincon on the Western coast of the island. The drive is normally only 2 hours, but we ran into construction. But a beautiful drive. This is not a hotel. It more like 2 story villa's with private plunge pools overlooking the ocean. We had a villa that overlooked the ocean and the outdoor breakfast area. This room was magnificent. a true wow factor - and we've seen some places believe me! Our requested champagne was chilled upon arrival. Huge double doors opened to the ocean view surrounded by flowering trees. I'd say this place was over 1200 square feet. It was equipped with a kitchen area but did not have stove or microwave. Did have a refrigerator and an awesome espresso maker that used pods. The pods were replaced daily. Full array of dishes and glasses. Upsatirs was a massive 4 poster king bed with a canopy, sitting area, ceiling fans, balconies that you could stand up on but not sit on - and the bathroom...huge shower, bidet and the largest 4 claw bathtub I have ever seen... or been in. It fit 2 with plenty of room to spare! We spent hours in the plunge pool. It was about 4 feet deep and about 7 feet by 6 feet. The filtration system constantly circulated the water. We bought candles in town and lined them around the pool at night...that was great. Speaking of night, we were serrenaded by the local tree frogs that sounded like birds all night..never saw one though...but it sounded great with the pounding of the surf..... While we were there, we hardly saw anyone - and to be sure it was off season since Sept. is most definately hurricane time. But we lucked out, no problems with the weather. We had total and complete privavcy. Tracked all storm activity via the internet prior to coming over. The restaurant was fantastic too. It would be a bit costly to eat there all the time, since we had a car, we went in town a few times and we hit the grocery store to get local things and take back. (we do this everywhere - even Paris which was the best place...2 bucks for Bourdeax and pate....) I have to say though that the Fresh Red Snapper dish was the best fish I ever ate. A couple draw backs....not deal killers, but know them...to keep with its seclusion and privacy, there are no telephones, radio, TV or internet access. We did not have any problems with cell phone calls though - just watch the cost. But if you need a TV or internet access, you are out opf luck. We brought a crank up radio that worked great. I did not have a wireless card with me so maybe that would work...It bothered me a bit - no internet to follow my college football!!!. We ventured into town and found a Cafe run by Mike from New Jersey - Cafe Viejas..and I was able to get online from there (saw the NFL games too! PLUS a great hamburger) The only issue we had with the weather was humidity. For the 1st 2 days, wow - be aware, you will sweat, especially if you are drinking! But the Pool helped that.... there is no real beach and you can't swim....but they have plenty of chairs on the bluff which gets sea spray it's so close. This didn't matter to us...we were in the pool. Also, if you are a Rum drinker, don't come thinking Rum in Puerto Rico (home of Bacardi) is cheap! It wasn't, although you could get cheap rum drinks...not any more expensive, but not cheap either. So if you want something special in Puerto Rico, privacy and excellent service, we would recommend this place...it is a destination for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This place is worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: gusd
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. The staff is incredible, the location is incredible, the restaurant is superb and the villas are perfect. We booked 2 nights of our honeymoon in this hotel after staying in old san juan at the Hotel El Convento. Leaving the El Convento was tough, it as well is a great hotel. Little did we know we would find another hotel that would surpass our experience in Old San Juan. The rooms in the horned dorset are very large and no expense has been spared. I can't say enough about the room or the attached personal plunge pool that we never really used because the infinity edge pool overlooking the ocean was too good to be true. The food (American Plan, breakfast and dinner) is amazing and well worth the hundred per person per day, it's a steal. The 4 course dinner alone is worth the 100. The wine is a bit pricey, we suggest going into the town of Rincon and hitting the grocery store....while there do not forget to check out the beaches and possibly take a surfing lesson. The beaches here are as good as advertised. I can't say enough about the experience and we cannot wait to go back. Also, we made the drive from Old San Juan to the hotel, plan on 2.5 to 3 hours depending on traffic. You will want the rental car to go in and see Rincon, although next time we are flying into Aguadilla not San Jose.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Horned Dorset”
Reviews.Author: bespoketravel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food and dining experience. The restaurant is 5 star plus. The chef is a gourmet and the meals were fantastic. The room was spacious and decorated with four poster beds. Some rooms had their own pool. Great terrace to relax . Elegant small classy hotel with fine service. Boutique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Leave Your Stress Behind”
Reviews.Author: Jrmat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days here to celebrate our 10th anniversary. On vacations, we tend to be on the go, trying to experience as much as possible. The Horned Dorset was a wonderful place to collapse when we needed to catch our collective breath. The facilities are top notch. Our suite was really a two story villa, with an incredible amount of space in excellent condition. The king size canopy bed was so comfortable, it was the best week of sleep I have had in months (maybe years). A really nice touch is the small pool in the patio behind the unit (each suite has one). If we were to make an effort to find something to complain about (which is difficult to do with this hotel), my wife thought the chairs in the suite weren't as comfortable as she would have liked, so she did most of here reading at the beach. If you want to eat here, breakfast is served on a patio overlooking the ocean, dinner is provided in a spacious dining room (also overlooking the water, through large windows). The food was a bit pricey, but well worth it, especially the breakfast. As for the beach, it's very private. I read an on-line review complaining that it was rocky. Yes, there are some large rocks at each end of the hotel's stretch of beach, but if you're picturing the coast of Maine, this is not that. The beach is sandy. The hotel has beach chairs and umbrellas on the sand ready to be used. There are snorkling fins and kayaks that can be used any time. For those wanting to stay away from the sand and salt, there are two pools on the grounds as well. We found the entire staff to be friendly and helpful. The suite was always clean. Any needs we had were taken care of. The grounds are effectively fenced off by walls and vegetation and there is a security guard patrolling the parking lot and nearby grounds around the clock. We always felt safe and secure. There are some folks who might not want to stay here because: 1. You want to spend most of your vacation in the San Juan area. It takes 2 - 2 1/2 hours to drive to San Juan from Rincon. We drove back to that side of the island one day. It's not that bad a drive, but I wouldn't want to do it more than one or two days during the trip. 2. You want a TV or internet access in your room. There are no TVs (we missed the first week of the Beijing Olympics, but we lived). You can get on the internet in the hotel's office, which we used to check email from time to time. To be honest, though, if TV or the internet are going to be major parts of your vacation, don't go to Puerto Rico - you should want to take advantage of what the island has to offer. 3. You want a "big resort" type experience - you know, the kind of place that has multiple bars or restaurants on site, a gift shop, an arcade . . . The Horned Dorset is not that type of resort. It is a place to relax, sit on the beach, read a book, swim, kayak . . . In short, we'll be going back. This is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Horned Dorset!”
Reviews.Author: blaztnbabe
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place! This was probably the most romantic place we have ever been. It was secluded and perfect for honeymooners. If you are looking for a peaceful place away from it all, this is your place! It's definitely private. We only saw one other couple at the pool the entire time we were there! We spent most of our time at the infinity pool but there was another bigger one and our own private pool. The beach was just ok but we didn't go for the beach. We stayed here for half of our stay and then went to San Juan for the other half, which I would highly recommend. Our villa was gorgeous. I have included pictures but they do not do it justice! Our favorite part was the canopy bed which was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and the private dipping pool. My husband had them put rose petals on the bed which was such a sweet surprise! The food was AMAZING. If you go, make sure to get on the meal plan. We saved a lot of money by doing this and ate like kings and queens! It included breakfast and dinner. We had breakfast right at the ocean each morning and ater dinner at the restaurant on site. It was delicious (lobster,veal, duck,,,etc and just as good dessert) . We found a few good local restaurants nearby. Tamboo was a really cool place to see and also The Lazy Parrot! I suggest going here for lunch because you don't want to miss dinner at Restaurant Aaron. The staff was wonderful. They were a little shy at first but once we started talking to them they went above and beyond for us! We had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend staying here. Go in the summer months and you will save TONS of money. Everything was wonderful, staff, food, accomodations! The ONLY bad thing we can say is that someone took a candy bar from our refrigerator but we had such a good time we didn't care. Hope you have as great of time as we did! Candice and Corey

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Pebbles4602
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment. Why would anyone pay $500/night plus airfare to go to a Carribbean Island to sit in a villa all day? That's what I ask myself with regards to the Horned Dorset. Lesson learned. Don't get me wrong, it's a beautiful place to stay. But Puerto Rico is full of beautiful beaches, great food, amazing rain forests, and a lot to do and see. The Horned Dorset offers great rooms, nice grounds, and a few pools. That's it!! The beach is terrible; rocky, dirty and small. The place is like a tomb all the time. There is never anything going on. It just seems so out of place in such a warm, latin country full of vibrant music and flavors. Definitely do not come here if you are young, energetic and fun loving. It's geared more toward older folk or boring people.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Coach2
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon Vacation: June 25, 2008-July 2, 2008 Traveling from: Laguna Beach, CA The hotel is beautiful, the service is wonderful, the food is fabulous, the beach is soooo warm and clear with no waves, and the room was to die for. The owner, Wilhelm, chose room 15 for us. It is a two-story ocean view villa with a large patio and dipping pool. We enjoyed relaxing out there as well as at the beach kayaking. The entire hotel is soooo quiet; the only noise comes from the tropical birds, frogs, and crickets. The weather does not feel as humid as San Juan. It is clear every day until about 3:00 when it rains for an hour, so get started early. We actually did have a TV, phone, and Bose system to hook up to an Ipod. There were two bathroooms, a living room, a dining room, a kitchen, a huge bedroom with the most comfortable canopy bed ever, a walk-in closet, and an extra bedroom. The air conditioning is pretty loud, but it didn't keep us awake. The rooms are cleaned every day with turn down service at night. I would definitely eat at Restaurant Aaron for dinner at least once. We only spent $150 for two people. I have attached some photos. We would definitely like to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ACCOMMODATIONS.....NOT SO GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BRLTHREE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Horned Dorset Primavera in Rincon, Puerto Rico. First, the good parts.... The setting, grounds and accommodations were spectacular. We felt like we were in Marbella, Spain. Looking at the property on line does not do it justice. The property houses guests in bi-level suites. The downstairs has a living room, kitchen, and bathroom with a shower. Upstairs is the sleepiing area with a large bathroom, shower, and huge tub. Each suite has a small private plunge pool and sitting area. The other very positive experience was dining. Whether it was breakfast, lunch or dinner, the food was well prepared and presented. The wait staff was very professional. Unfortunately, we found that service and attention to detail at the hotel was seriously lacking. Personally, I'd gladly trade spectacular accommodations, for spectacular service. The downstairs bathroom had no soap. There was an Espresso machine, in the kitchen. In the afternoon, I made some espresso us, and put the used cups in the sink. They were still in the sink after we returned from dinner, although there had clearly been turn down service. If we wanted coffee the next morning, we'd have to wash the dishes ourselves. There was no bath gel to use in that beautiful huge tub. One morning I got up early and decided to go outside by our pool. When I went to look for the pool towels, which are supposed to left in the rooms, there were none to be found. There was no directory in the suite explaining how to use phones; which rarely worked, book sightseeing, spa services etc. There was a lovely infinitey pool, with a few lounges. In the same area, was an umbrella table with a wicker basket filled with towels. next to the table was a cooler with water. I asked one of the hotel staff if it would be possible to get an umbrella for myself. He just kind of mumbled that they don't do umbrellas there, even though there were several umbrellas in the storage area beside the pool. At least the towels were shaded and cool. If a guest wanted a drink or something to eat by that pool, there was neither a hotel staff person, or even a phone to make such a request. Every afternoon it would rain. No one bothered to cover the lounge cushions, so by the time the sun came out again, everything was soaked, and no one could sit outside. Although they were never rude, the staff was just indifferent. Soap, pool towels for our plunge pool, and an umbrella are not outrageous requests. I would not recommend this hotel, nor will I go back.

Reviews.Title: “A truly unique hotel perfect for relax and romance”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravel007
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from it all The Horned Dorset in Ricon is a romantic french boutique hotel. Just be prepared to relax...there are no TV's and nothing nearby this hotel to do. It is pure luxury. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are immaculate. The grounds are beautiful. It is right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Come and experiened the most ideal place”
Reviews.Author: amySydney
Reviews.Content: During our staying here, I recognized that there is a most amazing place in this planet. It isnt a rumor or my own opinion. Just look the way they treated to guests not only for my family but also others. Everything is in hand and very comfortable, and so sweet....Our absolutly vote for this hotel Horned Dorset Primavera

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely heaven...(long review)”
Reviews.Author: Abs4You
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Horned Dorset for the first part of our honeymoon. We cannot stress enough how much we love and miss the Horned Dorset. ROOM: We stayed in a two story villa with a private wading pool outisde. We anticipated having no internet, television, etc. and, to be honest, we would not have used it had it existed. This villa was spacious and beautifully adorned (and the bed was super comfortable). The bathroom was beautiful, with a spacious tub and separate shower. POOLS: Although there was more than one pool, we spent our time at the pool that fed into the ocean (infinity pool). It was always clean, had a gorgeous view of the ocean, and made for fantastic pictures. Towels were always provided, as were bottles of water in a cooler. BEACH: We can't comment so much on the beach, as we honestly spent zero time on the beach. This is not because it was not beautiful, it was simply because we had such a relaxing time reading by the pool that we never had the chance to explore the ocean. FOOD: We ate both breakfast and lunch outside overlooking the beach. We are foodies, and we would have left the resort if we felt the need. Needless to say, we didn't. The options were plentiful, the service was great, and we especially recommend the mofongo for lunch. We ate each night at the restaurant at the hotel. We were pleased but not enthralled the first night, and we thought it might be because we were staying during the "off season." But our final two meals were fantastic - attentive service and delicious food. SERVICE: Service at the Horned Dorset was top notch. The owner honestly met us outside the hotel because we were having trouble finding the entrance. Everybody was incredibly welcoming and wanted to enhance your experience. We spent the second two nights on the veranda playing chess with our excellent bartender waiting on us. Additionally (and this might not fall under "service"), there are two awesome "house dogs" which make the experience even more intimate. ALL IN ALL: We spent six nights at the Ritz in San Juan following our nights at the Horned Dorset. While the remainder of the honeymoon was amazing, we could not stop talking about the Horned Dorset. We have every intention of returning there upon an anniversary. Thank you Horned Dorset, for making our honeymoon sublime. Sincerely, Abby and Dan

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular sea and sky views”
Reviews.Author: fbusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights just after New Year so the hotel was quiet. The accommodation is great - on 2 levels and spacious. Would recommend the rooms with sea views as you can sit in bed with the shutters open and sea/hear the waves. The views are what make this hotel so special; the bar over the water faces sunset and there are the most spectacular cloud formations. The beach is really only tiny but the 2 pools are lovely. The restaurant food was excellent and the best we had on P Rico in 2 weeks - we ate there each night - all good. We dont always eat breakfast but it was worth getting-up for to sit on the terrace by the sea - and because the house is Italianate in style it reminded us of being by the Italian Lakes. The only negative comment is that there were no special touches; such as a bottle of wine on arrival, fresh milk in the fridge, something to read... Bring a good book (lots of books) and watch the waves (we stayed at 4 hotels in 2 weeks and would recommend this with El Convento in San Juan, if you like small, character, quiet hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil, Serene, Sophisticated...”
Reviews.Author: skstein
Reviews.Content: It is hard to sum up in words the experience my boyfriend and I had at Horned Dorset; magical, euphoric, pure joy, untouched beauty all don't quite suffice. It's one of those places that you feel "in the know" for experiencing, like it is a long kept secret, a hidden door and that you somehow found the key. I came across the Horned Dorset website after a few days of extensive searching for a great place to take a quick, romantic vacation. It was not easy to find and I assume that is how they like it. However, once I did find it I knew we had to go. It can be a bit pricey but once you are there you realize it's a bargain for the price per night. Most 4 or 5 star vacation resorts, especially in the Caribbean will cost around $500/night (the disneyland-like Atlantis in the Bahamas does and all you get is a single, cookie cutter room with horribly cheesy bed spreads.) That being said we paid $420/night during off season for a two FLOOR garden villa with a private outdoor plunge pool and it was gorgeous. Working in real estate I can tell you this place is worth well more than that...but being that it is located on the west side of Puerto Rico I think that may bring the cost down. We seriously couldn't believe we had this all to ourselves. A living room, dining area, small kitchen (no stove), two full bathrooms one with a free standing tub and the most gorgeous wooden, 4 poster bed I have ever seen! The villa was meticulously appointed and fit in perfectly with the rest of the property. Decorated in a Mediterranean hacienda style you truly feel transported to another place in time, where there is no rush and relaxation is your only goal. Most of the property is crisp white surrounded by manicured palm trees and other vegetation. The main building where you can eat lunch, dinner or just play chess has red tiled floors and is decorated with hand picked ornaments and furniture. Pelicans fly by on a daily basis swooping down to grab a fish or two. These gorgeous birds are right at your fingertips putting on a show seemingly just for you. Okay I am rambling. The two pools on the property are great, the infinity pool which is visible from the entrance is smaller and not very deep, but when we were there we were the only people who sat by it so the size or depth didn't matter. We had the pool to ourselves! The pool by the main building is much larger and is very private and pretty. Most vacationers sit by that one. The beach is very small, almost non-existent on high tide days and you can't really swim in the water as it's quite rocky under the surf, but it's just so picturesque you don't really care. We spent a few hours each day after breakfast sitting out on the grass above the beach just reading and watching the birds. Again, it truly feels like your own secret hideaway. The best meal served there by far is breakfast. Sittting outside with linens, surrounded by sculptures eating from quaint dishware we felt like royalty. The creole french toast was out of this world and the service is more than accommodating. Lunch and dinner are served only in the main dining room and lunch on the porch of the main building as well. While the food is good it's a bit pricey and we didn't eat there for every meal. It'd be great if they expanded where they will serve you and the hours of service during the day a bit. But still not really worth complaining about. The location of Horned Dorset is a bit tricky to find as it's tucked away on a narrow, residential street but once you get acquainted with the small neighborhood it's easy to get around. Rincon is a small surf town and everyone there is laid back and LOVES their home. People from Rincon stay in Rincon. And while we were there we didn't want to leave either. It's a 2 hour drive to San Juan the bustling capital of Puerto Rico but we didn't care to make the drive, the west side of the island has culture, history and great driving roads. The whole experience was just phenomenal. The service at Horned Dorset was warm, welcoming and laid back. Everyone seemed genuinely happy. The atmosphere was the definition of peace and the style and appointments were pure sophistication. Horned Dorset is a truly special place that has a stolen a piece of my heart. We can't wait to return and hopefully one day own a villa on the Horned Dorset property to call home, aka paradise. If you are thinking about planning a trip to Horned Dorset and have any questions, do not hesitate to send me an email. Best, SKS.
